db:info.db:title: KeyboardLayout QML Type
db:info.db:edition: Qt Virtual Keyboard | Commercial or GPLv3

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This type is the root element of the keyboard layout. Use this element to build a new keyboard layout.

db:section.db:title: inputMethod : var
db:section.db:para: Sets the input method to be used in this layout.
This property allows a custom input method to be used in this layout.

db:section.db:title: inputMode : int
db:section.db:para: Sets the input mode to be used in this layout.
By default, the virtual keyboard attempts to preserve the current input mode when switching to a different keyboard layout.
If the current input mode is not valid in the current context, the default input mode is specified by the input method.

db:section.db:title: keyWeight : real
db:section.db:para: Sets the key weight for all children keys.
The default value is inherited from the parent element in the layout hierarchy.

db:section.db:title: sharedLayouts : var
db:section.db:para: List of layout names which share the input method created by the createInputMethod() function.
If the list is empty (the default) the input method is not shared with any other layout and will be destroyed when the layout changes.
The list should contain only the name of the layout type, e.g., ['symbols']. The current layout does not have to be included in the list.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0] smallTextVisible : bool
db:section.db:para: Sets the smallTextVisible for all children keys.
The default value is inherited from the parent element in the layout hierarchy.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0.

db:section.db:title: createInputMethod()
db:section.db:para: This function may be overridden by the keyboard layout to create the input method object dynamically. The default implementation returns null.

The input method object created by this function can outlive keyboard layout transitions in certain cases. In particular, this applies to the transitions between the layouts listed in the sharedLayouts property.
